thread.title: From Casual to Classy: 10 of the Best Bars and...

title: From Casual to Classy: 10 of the Best Bars and...
text:
By Sharell Cook Updated March 12, 2016 . 
Delhi's nightlife is varied, but you'll find the classiest bars and clubs in luxury hotels. These establishments attract an immaculately dressed rich crowd and a cover charge to match. However, numerous trendy casual stand-alone bars have recently opened up and are proving to be popular alternatives. Do note that the legal drinking age in Delhi is 25 and proof of age may be required. In addition, most bars close by 1 a.m. due to the nightlife curfew that's in place. Kitty Su at the Lalit. 1. Kitty Su 
Famous for hosting renowned international electronic music artists, Kitty Su is decked out for dancing and DJs. The sound setup is top quality, the dance floor is large, and the multiple bars mean that you don't have to wait long to get a drink. The club's funky decor adds to the party vibe. Not surprisingly, Kitty Su has been frequently named Delhi's best nightclub since it opened in 2011. It's also the only Indian club to have been featured in DJ Mag's Top 100 Clubs of the World. Address: The Lalit hotel, Barakhamba Avenue, Connaught Place. Phone: (11) 4444-7666. Opening Hours: Wednesday, Friday and Saturday, 10 p.m. until 3 a.m. Cover Charge: Ranges from 1,000-3,000 rupees. 
continue reading below our video Before Your Road Trip, Watch This Capitol. The Ashok Hotel 2. Capitol 
Capitol has been going strong since 2003 and is another option for partying late into the night beyond the city's curfew. This club has an open-air lounge, elevated VIP area, and huge dance floor. Expect to hear retro, commercial and Bollywood music on Saturdays. Address: The Ashok hotel, 50-B Diplomatic Enclave, Chanakyapuri. Phone: (11) 2687-9802. Opening Hours: 9 p.m. until 3.30 a.m. Cover Charge: Free during the week if on the guest list, otherwise 1,000 rupees per couple after midnight. 2,000 rupees per couple on weekends.
